hypothesis_content.title: BTC-ETH Ratio Mean Reversion in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: When the BTC/ETH price ratio deviates >2.5 standard deviations from its 30-day rolling mean during NEUTRAL regimes, it will revert to the mean within 5 trading days with >65% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes exhibit range-bound behavior with mean reversion tendencies. BTC-ETH correlation remains high (~0.85) while allowing temporary divergences. The 2.5σ threshold captures rare events while avoiding noise trades.
entry_conditions: Ratio momentum (5-day ROC) confirms overshoot (positive momentum on downside deviation, negative on upside)
Volume ratio (BTC vol/ETH vol) < 1.5x (no extreme divergence)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Ratio returns to within 0.5σ of 30-day mean
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Ratio extends to >3.5σ deviation from mean

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Win rate < 55% OR average holding period > 4 days OR Sharpe ratio < 0.8 in backtest across 2023-2024 neutral periods.
